NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

Consider the curve defined by <math alttext="2 times x squared, plus 3 times y squared, minus 4 x y, equals 36" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <msup> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> <msup> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mn>4</mn> <mi>x</mi> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>36</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.
content.question: (a) Show that <math alttext="the derivative of y with respect to x, equals the fraction with numerator 2 y minus 2 x, and the denominator 3 y minus 2 x, end fraction" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mo>ⅆ</mo> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>ⅆ</mo> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>y</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mi>y</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.

frqParts.text: (a) Show that <math alttext="the derivative of y with respect to x, equals the fraction with numerator 2 y minus 2 x, and the denominator 3 y minus 2 x, end fraction" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mo>ⅆ</mo> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>ⅆ</mo> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>y</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mi>y</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.
(b) Find the slope of the line tangent to the curve at each point on the curve where <math alttext="x equals 6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(c) Find the positive value of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at which the curve has a vertical tangent line. Show the work that leads to your answer.

(d) Let <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be functions of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> that are related by the equation <math alttext="2 times x squared, plus 3 times y squared, minus 4 x y, equals 36" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>36</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. At time <math alttext="t equals 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the value of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is 2, the value of <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="negative 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the value of <math alttext="the derivative of y with respect to t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Find the value of <math alttext="the derivative of x with respect to t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> at time <math alttext="t equals 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
